sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词含有"入口，进入"之意。
means: entrance ： 含义广泛，作"进入"解时，可用于许多场合；作"入口"解时，指有门或栏的入口处。
entry ： 强调正式地、礼仪地进入。用作"入口"解时，多指房门、院门、门廊等。
admittance ： 指许可进入某地或某建筑物。
admission ： 指被允许进入某公共场所或建筑物的权利，也指进入某一组织。

word_mean: 防波堤、导堤堤头之间或防波堤堤头与天然屏障之间的船舶出入口。(2) 河堤决口或堤坝封堵前预留的过流缺口。
设计水线面下，最大横剖面或平行中体前端到船体最前端的部分。

sentence.Network_en: The entrance hall is littered with toys and wellington boots.
sentence.Network_cn: 门厅里到处乱扔着玩具和雨靴。

sentence.Network_en: There were people at the entrance giving out leaflets.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人在入口处散发传单。

sentence.Network_en: If she had noticed her father's entrance, she gave no indication.
sentence.Network_cn: 就算她已经注意到了父亲的到来，她也会不动声色。

jx.jx_en_mean: (of an actor or performer) come on stage

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent. (in the sense 'right or opportunity of admission'): from Old French, from entrer 'enter'
late 16th cent. (formerly also as intrance): from en-, in- 'into' + trance

entry.def: The entrance to a place is the way into it, for example a door or gate.

example.ex: Beside the entrance to the church, turn right...
He was driven out of a side entrance with his hand covering his face...
example.tran: 他被从侧门赶了出来，一只手还捂着脸。

entry.tran: 到达;（尤指有意引人注目的）驾到，莅临
entry.def: You can refer to someone's arrival in a place as their entrance, especially when you think that they are trying to be noticed and admired.

example.ex: If she had noticed her father's entrance, she gave no indication.
example.tran: 就算她已经注意到了父亲的到来，她也会不动声色。

entry.def: When a performer makes his or her entrance on to the stage, he or she comes on to the stage.

example.ex: He made his entrance into the parade ring.

entry.def: If you gain entrance to a particular place, you manage to get in there.

example.ex: Hewitt had gained entrance to the Hall by pretending to be a heating engineer.
example.tran: 休伊特装扮成供热工程师从而进入大厅。

entry.tran: 入会资格;入学资格;入行资格
entry.def: If you gain entrance to a particular profession, society, or institution, you are accepted as a member of it.

example.ex: Entrance to universities and senior secondary schools was restricted.
example.tran: 进入大学或高中的资格受到限制。

example.ex: ...entrance exams for the French civil service.

entry.def: If you make an entrance into a particular activity or system, you succeed in becoming involved in it.

example.ex: The acquisition helped BCCI make its initial entrance into the US market.
example.tran: 那项并购帮助国际商业信贷银行首次跻身美国市场。

entry.def: If something or someone entrances you, they cause you to feel delight and wonder, often so that all your attention is taken up and you cannot think about anything else.

example.ex: As soon as I met Dick, he entranced me because he has a lovely voice...
example.tran: 我一遇到迪克，就被他那动听的声音迷住了。

example.ex: Last Friday she entranced the audience with her classical Indian singing.
example.tran: 上周五她演唱的经典印度歌曲让听众如痴如醉。

means.word_mean: 1. something that provides access (entry or exit);

sentences.sentence: "they waited at the entrance to the garden"
"beggars waited just outside the entryway to the cathedral"

auth_sentence.res_content: The southern entrance to Douma is flanked by checkpoints.

auth_sentence.content: Shaded gardens decorate the entrance of temples and houses.
auth_sentence.res_content: Shaded gardens decorate the entrance of temples and houses.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Shaded gardens decorate the entrance of temples and houses.

Sentence.sentence: He was so glad to see them that he didn't even think to read the sign by the entrance.
But what is certain is that, in some way or other, Google's entrance into digital book selling will have a significant impact on the book world in the years to come.
Google's entrance into digital book selling will tremendously change the world's book market in the future

sentences.en: The car waited at the front entrance.

means.word_mean: 进入; 登场; 入学

sentences.en: The singer's entrance was greeted with applause.
sentences.cn: 那位歌星在掌声中登场。

sentences.en: She had decided for taking the entrance exam.

jushi.english: I left my car outside the main entrance.
jushi.chinese: 我把小车停在正门外面。

jushi.english: He applied for entrance at a number of schools.
jushi.chinese: 他向好几所学校提出了入学申请。

jushi.english: She had decided on taking the entrance exam.
